intro: Sonchus bocconei, commonly known as the Boccone's sowthistle, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and serrated, lobed leaves. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a cluster, and bloom from late spring to early summer. It is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
